source.8f17a540:
#

How to copy this notebook?

To copy this notebook to start making your own modifications you just neet to click the button "Copy & Edit" that is in the upper right corner of the page. After doing that, you could make any change to it. Each block of code is named "cell". And to run a cel you need to put the cursor on it and hit "ctrl+Intro" in the keyboard. The next cell has some python modules that we will use (module = a bunch of useful functions). If you need to use those modules, you need to erase the "#". Let first run th
source.cc2c70ec:
#

Reading Data

We will only work with the "train.csv" data. So the next cell reads the data and save it under the name "train". One could read in the same way the other files; to do that one just needs to eliminate the character "#" of the beggining of the line and run again the cel. This could take like 30 seconds to run.
